clinical_study.brief_title: The Use of Hospital and Emergency Department of Refugee Patients
clinical_study.official_title: The Use of Hospital Outpatient Clinics and Emergency Department by Refugee Patients in Turkey

brief_summary.textblock: After Middle Eastern crisis, millions people were forced to migrate to European countries and especially neighboring countries. In Turkey, cities which are closed to east of border, face to cope more refugees' health care than those of other cities. The incidence of admission of hospital outpatient clinics and emergency department by refugee patients is not known clearly in our city, Nevsehir. In this study, we wanted to investigate use of health care among these patients in Nevsehir in Turkey.

primary_outcome.measure: The incidence of outpatient clinics and emergency department use by refugee patients
primary_outcome.description: Hospital outpatient clinics and emergency department use by refugee patients in a secondary care hospital.

intervention.description: To investigate characteristics of outpatient visits of refugee patients

study_pop.textblock: Refugee patients are registered in the hospital system in a different way than that of others. We will use these datas as recorded refugees. And also, we will use the number of other visits to calculate the incidence of visits of refugees.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
All patients who visited an outpatient clinic and emergency department.
Exclusion Criteria:
Patients who have missing records.
